description: The data container element for a student sponsor refund request

validation.validation: This web service doesn't support these fields: Document Payment Status, Document Status, Refund Amount, Refund Date. Remove data from those fields before submitting student sponsor refunds.
validation.description: These fields will all be set during processing of the Submit request.

validation.validation: The institutional academic unit for each student sponsor payment to be refunded must match the institutional academic unit submitted in this web service.
validation.description: The Institutional Academic Unit selected when recording Student Sponsor Payments must match the IAU selected in the Submit request.

validation.validation: One or more of the selected student sponsor payments doesn't match the selected company and sponsor. Select a different student sponsor payment to refund or change the company and sponsor.
validation.description: The Company, Institution, and Sponsor of the Payment being Refunded must match those of the Student Sponsor Refund to be created.

validation.validation: You can't use this web service to edit existing refunds.
Select at least one student sponsor payment to refund.
validation.description: A Student Sponsor Refund must be for at least one Student Sponsor Payment.

validation.validation: One or more of the selected student sponsor payments already has an associated student sponsor refund. Select a different student sponsor payment to refund.
validation.description: A Student Sponsor Refund cannot be Submitted for Payments which already have Refunds in progress or completed.

validation.validation: One or more of the selected student sponsor payments doesn't have a deposited on-account balance greater than zero. Select a different student sponsor payment to refund.
validation.description: Only Payments with an on-account, approved deposited balance that isn't canceled or returnedare eligible for Refund.

validation.validation: The payment type must have a payment method of check, cash, manual, wire, or EFT.
validation.description: This validation ensures all Submitted Payment Types have a valid Payment Method.

Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Indicates the transaction should process to completion before the response is generated.  Note: All < v12 operations will process with Run_Now = True for backwards compatibility but please review this setting in your environment for performance conditions.

Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step.  If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures a comment for the Business Process.

description: Container for the processing options for a business process. If no options are submitted (or the options are submitted as 'false') then the business process is simply initiated as if it where submitted on-line with approvals, reviews, notifications and to-do's in place. If the Initiator is an Integration System User, any validations you configured on the Initiation step are ignored.
